library(yaml)
library(dplyr)

# Load all events
myevents <- yaml::read_yaml("files_for_update/all_events.yml")

# Convert dates and sort
events_df <- bind_rows(myevents) %>%
  mutate(date = as.Date(date)) %>%
  arrange(date)

# Today's date
today <- Sys.Date()

# Separate upcoming and past
upcoming <- events_df %>% filter(date >= today)
past <- events_df %>% filter(date < today)

# Get the next upcoming event (if any)
next_event <- if (nrow(upcoming) > 0) upcoming[1, ] else NULL

if (!is.null(next_event)) {
cat(paste0(
  '<div class="featured-event-box">\n',
  '<h2 class="event-title">ðŸš¨ ', next_event$title, '</h2>\n',
  '<img src="', next_event$image, '" class="event-banner"/>\n',

# R for HTA in LMICs

**A global initiative to support HTA analysts in low- and middle-income countries using open-source R tools.**

We help health economists and decision modelers in LMICs use R for cost-effectiveness analysis and health technology assessment.

[Explore Our Workshops](workshops.qmd){.btn .btn-primary} [Meet the Committee](commitee.qmd){.btn .btn-outline}
:::

::: section-box
## Who We Are {.section-title}

[R-HTA in LMICs](about.qmd) is the regional chapter of the global [R-HTA](https://r-hta.org/) consortium.\
We promote the use of R for HTA in LMICs through open-access tutorials, workshops, and resources.

[Learn More](about.qmd)
:::
